alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; York (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 27 at 10:31AM EST until December 28 at 7:30PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Carolina... Broad River In SC Near Blacksburg affecting Cherokee and York Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Broad River In SC near Blacksburg. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Action Stage Flooding continues. The Broad River may be approaching River Rd. and Little Hope Rd. near US 29. Adjacent farmland and low-lying area flooding is continuing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 15.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 14.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 4.3 feet Monday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.1 feet on 01/18/2013. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp The next statement will be issued this evening at 1045 PM EST.
